messages.messageBody:
--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, spiritus saitou <spiritus_saitou@y...>
wrote:
> Kuraichan17@a... wrote:
>
> >>The example of animes they gave was Roni Henshin....lol.
>
> Oh, man! I can just see some poor fool going out there and looking
for that title. :-D If someone came up to me as a salesclerk in a
video/anime store and gave me that title, I'd never be able to stop
laughing. Or imagine the poor person going to the R's and finding
Rurouni Kenshin and standing there wondering if it's the same...
>
> Although, I guess the people who might be laughing hardest are
kendo instructors who have people coming to them wanting to learn
Hiten Mitsurugi Ryu or Gatotsu. :-D
>
> phil
>
>
>
> ---------------------------------
> Do you Yahoo!?
> Friends. Fun. Try the all-new Yahoo! Messenger

LOL thats funny! hmmmm for sure id know id be laughing my head off if
someone ever came up to me and asked if i knew what Roni Henshin >_<

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Slightly OT? Funny article
messages.msgSnippet: ... LOL! That s funny! I wonder if the idiot who wrote the article was trying to use his spell checker to double-check the name? Mine always insist the name
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/12/2004 12:08:04 AM Eastern Daylight Time, spiritus_saitou@... writes:

> >>The example of animes they gave was Roni Henshin....lol.
>
> Oh, man! I can just see some poor fool going out there and looking for that title. :-D If someone came up to me as a salesclerk in a video/anime store and gave me that title, I'd never be able to stop laughing. Or imagine the poor person going to the R's and finding Rurouni Kenshin and standing there wondering if it's the same...
>
> Although, I guess the people who might be laughing hardest are kendo instructors who have people coming to them wanting
> to learn Hiten Mitsurugi Ryu or Gatotsu. :-D
>
> phil

LOL! That's funny! I wonder if the idiot who wrote the article was trying to use his spell checker to double-check the name? Mine always insist the name should be Reran Denshin!

But phil it might be funny the fist half a dozen times someone asks to learn the Gatotsu, but don't you think after a while they'd just want to pull all their hair out? Sort of like the first few times you use the Babelfish are funny...

While we're off topic anyway, Samurai Rebellion is about to come on the IFC channel at 8:00am ET. If you miss it, I believe it comes on again tomorrow morning at 6:00am ET.

-MissBehavin

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Slightly OT? Funny article
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh, man!  I can just see some poor fool going out there and looking for that title.  :-D  If someone came up to me as a salesclerk in a video/anime store
messages.messageBody:
Kuraichan17@... wrote:

>>The example of animes they gave was Roni Henshin....lol.

Oh, man! I can just see some poor fool going out there and looking for that title. :-D If someone came up to me as a salesclerk in a video/anime store and gave me that title, I'd never be able to stop laughing. Or imagine the poor person going to the R's and finding Rurouni Kenshin and standing there wondering if it's the same...

Although, I guess the people who might be laughing hardest are kendo instructors who have people coming to them wanting to learn Hiten Mitsurugi Ryu or Gatotsu. :-D

phil

messages.subject: Slightly OT? Funny article
messages.msgSnippet: Yesterday I was reading an article in the Boston Globe, it was about the sudden interest in kendo lessons in the US. The article said that animes, books,
messages.messageBody:
Yesterday I was reading an article in the Boston Globe, it was about the
sudden interest in kendo lessons in the US. The article said that animes, books,
movies and other sources help increase interest in kendo. The example of animes
they gave was Roni Henshin....lol.





Kurai


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
